page.title: 05EDUCATION_KINNERTON/EVENJOBB
page.content: THERE WAS A BAPTIST SCHOOL IN EVENJOBB AND A DAME SCHOOL IN KINNERTON OLD SHOP OVER 1OO YEARS AGO.EVANCOYD PRIMARY SCHOOL OPENED 1864,CLOSED 1973 & A NEW AREA SCHOOL IN NEW RADNOR WAS OPENED IN JANUARY 1974.PRIMARY CHILDREN FROM THE CATCHMENT AREA (BARLAND,KINNERTON,EVENJOBB> ARE TAKEN BY FREE TRANSPORT TO NEW RADNOR. CHILDREN START SCHOOL AFTER THEIR 4TH BIRTHDAY & AT 11 GO TO JOHN BEDDOE'S COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL AT PRESTEIGNE. PRE-SCHOOL EDUCATION IN THE FORM OF PLAYGROUPS IS PROVIDED VOLUNTARILY BY PARENTS & HELD AT THE OLD SCHOOL BUILDING, NEW RADNOR. THE MAJORITY OF CHILDREN GO ON TO FURTHER EDUCATION AT UNIVERSITIES, POLYTECHNICS, COLLEGES ETC. ADULTS CAN TAKE PART IN FURTHER EDUCATION AT LLANDRINDOD WELLS OR EVENING CLASSES HELD LOCALLY.
